citation.article-title: Methanogenium frittonii Harris et al. 1996 is a later synonym of Methanoculleus thermophilus (Rivard and Smith 1982) Maestrojuán et al. 1990.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Methanogenium Romesser et al. 1981 emend. Maestrojuán et al. 1990

The description of this genus is that given by Romesser et al. (1979), emended by Maestrojuán et al. (1990), except that optimal temperatures for growth are between 15 and 35 °C and optimal NaCl concentrations range from 0·35 to 1·25 M.
The type species is Methanogenium cariaci.
